title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.2: EDUCATION ACCESS, RETENTION& QUALITY

description.narrative: Output 2: By 2024, in selected educational divisions, 1,609,045 children and adolescent girls and boys aged 5-17 years are equally supported to access and continue in formal or non-formal learning institutions, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development, Skills Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more children (5â€“17 years), especially adolescent girls, acquire competencies through access to quality and inclusive learning.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants

Provision of skills development for multiple age groups (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2: By 2024, in selected educational divisions, 1,609,045 children and adolescent girls and boys aged 5-17 years are equally supported to access and continue in formal or non-formal learning institutions

[Number of adolescent girls and boys out of school that are supported with access to existing alternative learning, including vocational training.] Nombre d'adolescents filles et garons en dehors de l'ecole soutenus pour accder l'apprentissage alternatif existant, y compris la formation professionnelle.
Number of children provided with teaching and learning materials to support home study in short term school closures with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]

[Number of elementary school teachers trained on at least one element of the overall curriculum reform.] Nombre d'enseignants du primaire ayant reu une formation sur au moins un lment de l'ensemble de la rforme du curriculum.
Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
